law.catch_line: A person who fails to comply with the relief granted in an interim protective order under § 4-504.1...

text.section:
A person who fails to comply with the relief granted in an interim protective order under § 4-504.1(c)(1), (2), (3), (4)(i), (7), or (8) of this subtitle, a temporary protective order under § 4-505(a)(2)(i), (ii), (iii), (iv), (v), or (viii) of this subtitle, or a final protective order under § 4-506(d)(1), (2), (3), (4), or (5), or (f) of this subtitle is guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction is subject, for each offense, to:
for a first offense, a fine not exceeding $1,000 or imprisonment not exceeding 90 days or both; and
for a second or subsequent offense, a fine not exceeding $2,500 or imprisonment not exceeding 1 year or both.

An officer shall arrest with or without a warrant and take into custody a person who the officer has probable cause to believe is in violation of an interim, temporary, or final protective order in effect at the time of the violation.
